intro: Sphaerostephanos superbus, commonly known as the giant moonflower, is a striking plant native to the humid lowlands of Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night and close by dawn. The plant has a woody stem with thick, succulent leaves that store water, adapting it to its tropical environment. Its flowers are composed of numerous small petals arranged in a spherical shape, giving it a unique appearance. Sphaerostephanos superbus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and nocturnal blooming habit.
